meanings.definition: One who pampers or indulges someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The pamperer always made sure his pet cat had the softest bed.
meanings.sent2: The pamperer spoiled her dog with gourmet treats and fancy toys.
meanings.sent3: The pamperer's dedication to his plants was so extreme that he sang to them every day.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the pamperer of the office, always bringing in homemade snacks for her coworkers.
meanings.sent5: The pamperer's love for her car was evident in the meticulous way she washed and waxed it every weekend.

meanings.definition: To treat with excessive indulgence or care.
meanings.sent1: She would pamperer her little sister by letting her have all the candy she wanted.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy couple would pamperer themselves with luxurious spa treatments every month.
meanings.sent3: He decided to pamperer his car by getting it detailed every week, much to the amusement of his friends.
meanings.sent4: The chef would pamperer the dish with a sprinkle of truffle oil before serving it to the guests.
meanings.sent5: After a long week of work, she decided to pamperer herself with a bubble bath and a good book.
